page.title: 03FARMING : E. MASCOTT ESTATE
page.content: There are two main land owners in this area:{The National Trust}and the {Eaton Mascott Estate}(ten farms in total). The land to the south of the A458 road is part of the Eaton Mascott Estate owned by Sir Peter Holcroft and has 4 farms. Of these two are tenant farmed {-Manor Farm (1658)}and{Grove Farm. Holcroft's with one worker farm the others. Manor Farm,{Berrington Farm and Grove House Farm are all built on the quadrangle style with barns and storage sheds on three sides. One farm house,{Cantlop Mill}has just been sold (Â£50000) as a private dwelling but the land has been retained by the Estate. There are five tied{cottages.}The main crops are{barley, sugar beet, wheat and{hay.}There is mixed woodland and {sheep}grazing on Birch Hill.
